page.title: 17Halewood - An Area of Change
page.content: Halewood has changed dramatically over the last 40 years. In 1945 it was a small scattered village of around 2,000 people. There were only two shops, these shops being a post office and a general store. Now it has many shops and a population of over 20,000. In the past many people worked on the local farms and on the railway - Halewood had its own station. Most of the travel to and from work was by bicycle or on foot. Most of the older residents welcome the changes that have come as life is easier, particularly on farms. Some would prefer to see the community spirit revived and less vandalism. Welcome improvements are a good bus service, more for school children to do both at school and in organisations such as Brownies and Cubs.
